title: BrSPR-20-P1 peptide isolated from Brevibacillus sp. developed into liposomal hydrogel as a potential topical antimicrobial agent
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,27394-27411
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA03722G, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Narumon Changsan, Apichart Atipairin, Pajaree Sakdiset, Poowadon Muenraya, Neelam Balekar, Teerapol Srichana, Rutthapol Sritharadol, Suranate Phanapithakkun, Somchai Sawatdee
BrSPR-20-P1 antimicrobial peptide (P1-AMP) is a novel antimicrobial peptide isolated from Brevibacillus sp. SPR-20 and has been developed as a liposomal in chitosan hydrogel. It has potential to be used as a topical antimicrobial agent.
